poem:
**Brush Strokes of Time**

In the quiet chambers of memory,  
a woman paints her legacy,  
brush weaving stories between shadows  
and light; the canvas her testament  
to the silence of colors.  
Dust settles, yet her hues remain  
eternal—whispering to those who pause,  
an echo of creation,  
intimate as prayer.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
